TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Q. Where are the IVAs?
A. A great deal of time and effort required that I sadly do not have. Manned capsules will aim to have IVAs, but larger station parts will have to make-do with placeholders.
For the 2 stage LK, I do remember someone on here made a version for Tantares.  I unfortunately can't remember their name, nor do I have the time to look for them, but someone has to remember!
@Deltac Him?

On 12/05/2017 at 8:06 PM, Third_OfFive said:

@Beale

For your next release, could you add IVAs to a few of your station parts? Pleeease? 

On 12/05/2017 at 8:10 PM, NISSKEPCSIM said:

He said that he will try to do so for the spacecraft (Soyuz, TKS, etc.), but that making IVAs for large station parts is too much hassle for something most people won't use. (Paraphrasing there - also, sorry if I came across a bit rude)

EDIT:

But we both live in hope... 

On 12/05/2017 at 8:12 PM, steedcrugeon said:

I am pretty sure IVA's is something he is looking into, however they are very Intensive toe create, often requiring more detailed textures then you may find on external parts. They are very time consuming to produce, I'm just happy he's churning out such good / stock compatible parts at this great rate!

On 12/05/2017 at 8:12 PM, onlinegamesz said:

Q. Where are the IVAs?
A. A great deal of time and effort required that I sadly do not have. Manned capsules will aim to have IVAs, but larger station parts will have to make-do with placeholders.

Basically all of the above  

I have some playing around with a MIR core block IVA, many thanks for @steedcrugeon for help and inspiration on what direction that should take.

 

On 12/05/2017 at 9:06 PM, Deltac said:

For the 2 stage LK, I do remember someone on here made a version for Tantares.  I unfortunately can't remember their name, nor do I have the time to look for them, but someone has to remember!

On 12/05/2017 at 9:09 PM, NeoFatalis said:

@Deltac Him?

Yes! @blacsky33 made a fantastic implementation as an optional alternative. Still up to date too  

I've had some very interesting discussions recently on this, and I think it is worth another shot, perhaps as an alternative (No more breaking compatibility pls!). Btw, a two stage LK shedding the frame mass could almost certainly enter orbit from Duna.

 

Have you heard of @steedcrugeon? He's a beautiful man. Courtesy of below:

It's basically house-work.

I like this nozzle colour, what do you think?

 New.
 2New.

Tantares has been a staple part of my gamedata folder ever since I startade playing KSP. It's great to see this new version taking shape.

Here's my attempt at recreating the early Soyuz and Progress models. Still missing some details, such as the large Igla rendezvous antenna (which I'm hoping will make a return at some point). Also, ignore the Soyuz-T in the image. It's showing the wrong craft.

What does the first image remind me of?  

I love the video and the setup! This is how I need to launch all my Proton from now on! 

2 hours ago, SBKerman said:

Tantares has been a staple part of my gamedata folder ever since I startade playing KSP. It's great to see this new version taking shape.

Here's my attempt at recreating the early Soyuz and Progress models. Still missing some details, such as the large Igla rendezvous antenna (which I'm hoping will make a return at some point). Also, ignore the Soyuz-T in the image. It's showing the wrong craft.

Beautiful designed image! And very nice to hear  

To my mind, what still remains for the Soyuz pieces:

  • Soyuz 7K-OK docking ports.
  • IGLA stuff.
  • Docking Light.
  • Cupola.
  • Better RCS.

For the Progress, there is an entire set of Progress-M parts in the works.

Space Feesh!

It sucks up all the space trash!  Also doesn't have a launch escape system apparently
The tanker I got to use while the Progress monoprop core is, well, in progress

Another National Collaboration Mission: The Kerbin Atoll Research Station!

A dedicated research laboratory to planetary sample acquisition and testing based off of the Antaeus Orbiting Quarantine Facility researched in 1978. This station houses a permanent crew of 5 (one Pilot and 4 Scientists) and resides in Mid-Kerbin Orbt (~200 km).

KARS is built of 4 modules: 6-sided docking module, power module, lab module and the hab module, with the solar arrays maintaining attitude towards the sun at all times [The power module also houses small jets to change altitude if need be (albeit minor changes)].

The lower node is for Logistics which arrive periodically, and the other two are for crew transfer or for any other station augmentation.

The Science lab also contains a port for sample acquisition which can be itself quarantined if need be.

ALSO: There are contingency plans for samples that break quarantine... a beefed-up upper stage will dock with the 18t station and inject it into interplanetary space to prevent samples from contaminating Kerbin;
